peopleAlsoAsk.question: How to determine the value of an Elgin pocket watch?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: Open the back and get it serial number. Then look it up on the pocket watch database website. It's worth what people are willing to pay. I paid 25 for a 1907 Elgin at an estate sale and it needed a $50 service.
peopleAlsoAsk.title: What's my Elgin pocket Watch worth and when was it made? - Reddit

peopleAlsoAsk.question: What makes an Elgin watch valuable?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: Elgin pocket watches are revered for their craftsmanship and historical significance. Produced by the Elgin National Watch Company, one of America's most esteemed watchmakers, these timepieces are prized by collectors for their intricate designs, durability, and the precious metals often used in their construction.
peopleAlsoAsk.title: How Much Gold is in an Elgin Pocket Watch? A Detailed Guide

peopleAlsoAsk.question: How much is an Elgin worth?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet:
Depending on the material the watch is made of, as well as the year of production and the significance of the particular model, prices for a railroad pocket watch generally tend to range from anywhere from $200 to $5,000. It's worth noting here that only about 10% of cases ever sold were solid gold.
Jul 23, 2018
peopleAlsoAsk.title: Elgin Watches: Prices for Antique Wrist and Pocket Watches

peopleAlsoAsk.question: Is Elgin a high-end watch?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: Their cost rarely exceeds a few hundred dollars, although some of its rarer gold-cased and railroad watches can reach four figures. At their best, high-end Elgins were exquisitely made, but it's the workhorse models that are often more appealing. Your grandpa and mine might well have owned one.
